And I was very asked to ask you a question: Why is Reni fighting using physical strength? Why she doesn't use magic?
As a dragon, she must be very good at magic.
If I recall correctly, it was asked as well during the city fight, and it came down to her being very much still a juvenile who isn't yet confident in welding magic effectively.
Could be misremembering tho.
Dragons are creatures of magic, for sure. It comes to them naturally, but they do still have to learn how to use it. Reni's only 20 and hasn't trained any combat magic.
She has her natural abilities as a dragon (telepathy, shapeshifting, fire breathing) but no advanced magic.

I'll be honest, the coding for the 2nd amnesia game has some weird stuff in it, lol
Like the UI and such is affected by icon size from your desktop settings
I had to go from 125% -> 100% to center everything
weird
Maybe they were on a different engine or something and weren‚Äôt sure of all its oddities.
What makes it really weird is that it's in real time xD
If I start up the game and forget to downsize everything, I can home out and change the setting, and then everything is fine once I hop back in
I must give the game credit, they do a good job of freaking you out, lol
Constant creaking, the pitter patter of footstops, giant freaking earthquakes that shake the entirety of the building to make you walk slow

I get to the main lobby of the mansion and they give the tutorial on how to run and it freaked me out.  But it was a fakeout because it took a bit of exploring, and I finally released a monster by accident
Yeah, it‚Äôs incredible the difference when you can tell they really put time into crafting the atmosphere.
Lighting too, the Portal team (and now Alyx) is really good with lighting for not being true horror.
The Dead Space guys too were top notch at atmosphere and lighting too.
I still need to play 3
But 2 still has the best "oh shit" moments I've ever seen
In particular, the school gymnasium and the return to the U.S.S. Ishimura
I loved how it looked all sterile and definitely under construction
But due to the first game, and everything that's going on, you're freaking the flip out the moment you set foot inside
Yeah, eh, it def is fun for another taste of the universe but 2 did so much so well
Yeah
And it isn't until like 5 - 10 minutes later that you FINALLY start encountering necromorphs
Especially when you get to the one corridor and it's non-stop necromorphs from both directions for 5 minutes
I was freaking out the entire time!
Haha, multi-layer atmosphere building lol
I stopped at the perfect place in A Machine for Pigs
Go into a secret corridor, see a two-way painting, creature lying in a caged bed in a room that was locked
You need to restart the "great machine", which was probably shaking the entire flippin' mansion
I did that, I go back down the corridor, bed's empty, door's open
And now I'm saved at the perfect, "Well... f*ck" moment
Now I gotta wonder if the thing's lurking in the house and I'll have to play hide and seek
Or if it just straight up bolted for an exit
Probably have to ransack a bunch of tough to reach rooms for random objects
Is the object of that game to escape or is it just wander around scared aimlessly?
The Amnesia / Soma games tend to be explore the environment and solve puzzles while trying to survive and get an idea of what the flip is going on
I'm playing A Machine for Pigs first because even though it's a later title, it's a bit slimmed down compared to the origial Dark Descent game
Not as much management, less to interact with, etc
It's a good way to get a feel for the game before ramping up the difficulty
Ah, okay, yeah I remember when AMfP came out I think it came out a long time later or something and the internet was thrilled there was a sequel
Eh I guess it was only 3 years
